availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Effingham County, Illinois, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Elizabeth Manes. Father of King S. Manes and Mary E. Manes. Farmer in Effingham County, Illinois, in 1850. Resident of Effingham County in 1855. Accused of kidnapping Thomas M. Adams from Richland County in August 1863. Reported as a fugitive to the states of Ohio and Kentucky in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Effingham County, p. 309A.
Illinois States Census (1855), Census of Inhabitants, Effingham County, Illinois, p. 11.
